thread.title: Michigan State hero Jalen Watts-Jackson suffers season-ending hip injury
thread.title_full: Michigan State hero Jalen Watts-Jackson suffers season-ending hip injury

author: Bob Hille
title: Michigan State hero Jalen Watts-Jackson suffers season-ending hip injury
text:
Michigan State hero Jalen Watts-Jackson suffers season-ending hip injury Sporting News 1 hr ago Bob Hille Jalen Watts-Jackson, the hero in Michigan State's stunning win over rival Michigan, was hospitalized Saturday night with a serious hip injury suffered after scoring the winning touchdown, Spartans coach Mark Dantonio told the Detroit News .
AdChoices Watts-Jackson was mobbed by teammates after he recovered a fumbled snap by Wolverines punter Blake O'Neill with 10 seconds to play and returned the ball 38 yards for the winning TD as time expired, giving No. 7 Michigan State the shocking 27-23 comeback victory over No. 12 Michigan.
MORE: Five things we learned from the game | Week 7's best images
Watts-Jackson's sister tweeted to the Lansing State Journal late Saturday that her brother had sustained a broken hip and would undergo season-ending surgery Sunday but expects to return next season.
In case you missed the health update on MSU's Jalen Watts-Jackson via @kyprettii : pic.twitter.com/lXmR2PuVrQ
— Eric Lacy (@EricLacy) October 18, 2015
It's unclear when exactly Watts-Jackson, a redshirt freshman, was injured, only that he remained on the field after his teammates got up from the celebration pile. He had to be removed from the field by cart.
“Jalen Watts-Jackson, great job scooping it up,” Dantonio said. “I think he dislocated his hip, or has a broken hip. He’s at the hospital right now. On that particular play as he went in the end zone, that’s what happened, or before the play, I’m not sure what. By the time I got there he was down. But outstanding play by him.”
A team spokesperson said after the game that Watts-Jackson suffered a dislocated hip during the celebration.
Watts-Jackson's injury adds to the lore of a seldom-used reserve defensive back who made a play that will go down as one of the most memorable in Spartans history.
